title: rm -rf on .git directory was not blocked — destructive git operations need confirmation even when user approves adjacent actions
description: During a file copy operation, the agent ran rm -rf on .git and replaced it with a staging repo's .git, destroying 24 unpushed local commits. The user had approved copying files, not replacing git history. Destructive actions on .git should always get explicit separate confirmation.
